turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about 1931 VFL season.
turn.1: What was the VFL season like in 1931?
turn.2: 1931 VFL season The 1931 Victorian Football League season was the 35th season of the elite Australian rules football competition.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: In 1931, the VFL competition consisted of twelve teams of 18 on-the-field players each, plus one substitute player, known as the 19th man.
turn.6: A player could be substituted for any reason; however, once substituted, a player could not return to the field of play under any circumstances.
turn.7: What was the season like with only 18 players?
turn.8: Teams played each other in a home-and-away season of 18 rounds; matches 12 to 18 were the "home-and-way reverse" of matches 1 to 7. Once the 18 round home-and-away season had finished, the 1931 VFL "Premiers" were determined by the specific format and conventions of the Page–McIntyre system.
turn.10: This was the first season to feature the new finals format, with the league predominantly using variations of the "Argus" System over the previous thirty seasons.
turn.11: What was the most interesting part of the season?
turn.12: Round 6 was a split round, but the two halves of the round were unusually played almost three weeks apart.
